job_tasks.phrase: developing, maintaining, and/or customizing new and existing tools for research purposes.
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core software engineering task of building and maintaining software tools, which aligns with the definition of developing and integrating software.

job_tasks.phrase: help set-up a digital support structure for the department, maintaining an overview of available tools, and offering small-scale programming support for individual researchers.
job_tasks.justification: Setting up a digital support structure and offering programming support are traditional software engineering and IT support tasks, fitting into the development and integration category.

job_tasks.phrase: supporting the development and implementation of this platform.
job_tasks.justification: This refers to the practical work of building and deploying a digital platform, which is a core software development activity.

job_tasks.phrase: offering computational support to researchers with their research
job_tasks.justification: Providing computational support implies developing or adapting software solutions for research needs, falling under software development.

job_tasks.phrase: helping to manage the computational research infrastructure of the department
job_tasks.justification: Managing infrastructure, even for research, involves operational aspects similar to DevOps/MLOps, focusing on the availability and maintenance of computational resources.

job_tasks.phrase: offering support in the education of technical skills, such as programming or (automated) data collection and annotation
job_tasks.justification: While educational, the context is supporting technical skills like programming and data collection, which are foundational to software development and data engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: collaborating with researchers within the NWO-KIC project for the technical development of a self-management platform
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly states technical development of a platform, which is a core software engineering task.

soft_skills.phrase: The successful candidate will divide their time primarily between these two domains.
soft_skills.justification: This implies a need to coordinate and work across different areas, suggesting collaboration.

soft_skills.phrase: The research software engineer will offer support to researchers, PhD candidates and (research master) students
soft_skills.justification: Offering support to various groups of people indicates a need for communication and collaboration skills.

soft_skills.phrase: offering small-scale programming support for individual researchers.
soft_skills.justification: Providing support to individuals requires clear communication and understanding of their needs.

soft_skills.phrase: collaborating with researchers within the NWO-KIC project
Since this is a new function, we anticipate that the successful candidate will help set-up a digital support structure for the department
soft_skills.justification: Setting up a new function and structure implies a need for adaptability and learning new processes or organizational needs.

soft_skills.phrase: develop a digital self-management platform that aims to help people with, for example, a history of depression to better monitor their own well-being, in order to prevent relapse.
soft_skills.justification: Understanding the goal of the platform (helping people with depression monitor well-being to prevent relapse) requires understanding the business/research context and user needs.

soft_skills.phrase: explore to what extent other sources of information can be integrated in this platform as well.
soft_skills.justification: Exploring integration possibilities requires understanding the platform's goals and how new data sources can contribute to them.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses heavily on traditional software engineering tasks such as developing, maintaining, and customizing tools for research, setting up digital support structures, and technical development of a platform. While it mentions computational methods and data analysis, there is no explicit mention of AI/ML models, generative AI, LLMs, or related specialized tasks. The role is about supporting research through software engineering, not building AI/ML systems themselves. Therefore, it fits the 'Software Engineer' profile.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is very clear and specific about the tasks involved, which are consistently related to software development and infrastructure management for research purposes. There is no ambiguity or mention of AI/ML specific tasks that would suggest a different profile. The language is direct and descriptive of a software engineering role.
